title: Vindicated George Venardos quits IOOF board
text:
Former IOOF chairman George Venardos will retire from the embattled wealth manager's board of directors after the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority failed to obtain disqualification orders against him.

Mr Venardos, who was chairman of IOOF from 2016 to 2018 and a director since 2009, will retire at the company's annual general meeting on 28 November.

Former IOOF chairman George Venardos will exit the board in November. AFR

He has been on indefinite leave from the board pending the outcome of APRA's ultimately unsuccessful action against IOOF and directors, including Mr Venardos, for alleged breaches of superannuation trustee duties.

"George has served the IOOF board with professionalism," IOOF chairman Allan Griffiths told the Australian Securities Exchange.

"He played a significant part in driving IOOF's growth through multiple acquisitions and divestments."
description: Former IOOF chairman George Venardos will retire from the embattled wealth manager's board of directors after APRA failed to ban him from the industry.
